intro: Diclis rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf diclis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Madagascar. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest understory habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and flies, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity. Diclis rotundifolia is relatively small in size, with a compact growth habit that makes it suitable for cultivation in shaded garden environments.
